page.title: 12Bridgnorth Charity Walk
page.content: The Bridgnorth Walk is a traditional sponsored walk held on Spring Bank Holiday Monday from Bridgnorth to and up the Brown Clee Hill and back again, a distance of 22 miles. The walk commences in the High Street, and is usually started by the Town Mayor and the walkers follow the Ludlow Road to Ditton Priors, climb the Clee and walk back to Bridgnorth. For children, there is a shorter 7 mile walk which starts and finishes in Ditton Priors and takes the walkers to the summit of the Clee. Participants in the walk raise money for various charities by walking as a team of ten and by being sponsored for each mile they walk by kind friends. The walk is very popular and has to be restricted to 800 adults and 300 children, although lots more would like to take part.In 1986, 17,000 pounds will be raised.
